document.ModsDocTitle: The Doryctinae (Braconidae) of Costa Rica: genera and species of the tribe Heterospilini
document.docAuthor: Marsh, Paul M., Wild, Alexander L. & Whitfield, James B.
document.masterDocTitle: The Doryctinae (Braconidae) of Costa Rica: genera and species of the tribe Heterospilini

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Doryctinae (Braconidae) of Costa Rica: genera and species of the tribe Heterospilini

subSubSection.paragraph: Heterospilus bicolor Marsh sp. n. Figure 142

Top label (white, printed) - Costa Rica: Prov. Puntarenas [;] ACO, Golfito, PN Corcovado [;] Est. Agujas, Cerro Rincon, 745m [;] 17. iv- 16.v.1999, J. Azofeifa [;] L.S. 276900-521500 #52781; second label (red, partially printed and hand written) - HOLOTYPE [;] Heterospilus [;] bicolor [;] P. Marsh. Deposited in ESUW.

1 ♀, COSTA RICA: Puntar. [;] P.N. Corcovado, Est. [;] Sirena, 50m [;] IV-VII 1989 (ESUW). 3 ♀♀, Costa Rica: Alajuela [;] 5km. W San Ramon [;] 1200m, April 1997 [;] O. Castro & P. Hanson (ESUW). 1 ♀, Costa Rica: Puntarenas [;] Res Forestal Golfito Dulce [;] 3km, SW Rincon, 10m [;] ii.1993, P. Hanson [;] Malaise, primary forest (ESUW). 1 ♀, COSTA RICA: Limon [;] P.N. Tortuguero [;] Est. 4-esquinas, 0m [;] VI-VIII 1989, Solano (ESUW).
The bicolored brown and yellow body and costate-granulate vertex are distinctive for the species
The specific name is in reference to the bicolored antennae, head, metasomal terga and stigma.

caption.paragraph: Figure 142. Heterospilus bicolor Marsh, sp. n.: A-D paratype E holotype.
